subject: Simplify test for hashed tokens, to cope with large v3 tokens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-16 13:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/cms.py'], 'message': "Simplify test for hashed tokens, to cope with large v3 tokens

The current approach of checking the identfier octets at the start
of the token string seems error prone, and doesn't work with large
tokens, as noted in the comments.

Instead, use knowledge of the content and size of the hex-encoded
hashed token, which will be a 32 character hex string (in the case
of both UUID and PKI tokens) - i.e if it doesn't meet the expected
criteria it should be hashed.

Change-Id: I3e7907c474dd350b08abdf488bc36a0c82541de6
Partial-Bug: #1240163
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify test for hashed tokens, to cope with large v3 tokens

The current approach of checking the identfier octets at the start
of the token string seems error prone, and doesn't work with large
tokens, as noted in the comments.

Instead, use knowledge of the content and size of the hex-encoded
hashed token, which will be a 32 character hex string (in the case
of both UUID and PKI tokens) - i.e if it doesn't meet the expected
criteria it should be hashed.

Change-Id: I3e7907c474dd350b08abdf488bc36a0c82541de6
Partial-Bug: #1240163

commit_message:
Add byte unit constants

A lots of numeric expressions are needed to caculate byte number
across Nova project, such as 1024*1024 , 1024**3 etc. This patch
add constants and will replace these numeric expressions in
following patches. That makes code more readable.Use these constants
like: root_disk_gb = 5 * unit.Gi

blueprint byte-unit-clean

Change-Id: Ic9aad949733d375aaa695d4292ff1b171d1def78

In this scneario we are going to run a lot of VMs one by one.
Usually one network has about 500 fixed ips (or we will get performance issues)

So if we are going to run 2k vms we should use at least 4 networks.

To simplify configuration of this test. We will by default chose

'}]
commit_message:
Use random network in boot_server scenario

In this scneario we are going to run a lot of VMs one by one.
Usually one network has about 500 fixed ips (or we will get performance issues)

So if we are going to run 2k vms we should use at least 4 networks.

To simplify configuration of this test. We will by default chose
random network to get ip for vm.

Change-Id: If5d8c52b4f02315be2bcc542baf43cdcc0989316

subject: Fix precondition checks for test_network_basic_ops
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-23 08:45:46.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/network/test_network_basic_ops.py'], 'message': 'Fix precondition checks for test_network_basic_ops

Running tempest with quantum disabled would previously raise
skip exceptions indicating that one of public_router_id or
public_network_id was required.  These values are not required
if quantum is disabled.  This change ensures that the presence
of these values will only be checked if quantum is enabled.

The master branch already behaves this way, but the behavior
there relies on a refactor that would have been difficult to
backport.

Change-Id: I4eee9403b219fd97d16faae0ed2b11348edbc04e
Closes-Bug: #1243593
'}]
commit_message:
Fix precondition checks for test_network_basic_ops

Running tempest with quantum disabled would previously raise
skip exceptions indicating that one of public_router_id or
public_network_id was required.  These values are not required
if quantum is disabled.  This change ensures that the presence
of these values will only be checked if quantum is enabled.

The master branch already behaves this way, but the behavior
there relies on a refactor that would have been difficult to
backport.

Change-Id: I4eee9403b219fd97d16faae0ed2b11348edbc04e
Closes-Bug: #1243593

subject: Include troveclient/compat/tests in testr
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-23 12:28:39.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/compat/tests/__init__.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'troveclient/compat/tests/test_common.py', '.testr.conf'], 'message': 'Include troveclient/compat/tests in testr

All tests should be included in testr.

In test_common.py, the testr command line will be read for parsing,
finally emit error message:
run.py: error: no such option: -t

we should mock the sys.argv in setUp().

The analysis is here
--------------------
troveclient/compat/common.py: CommandsBase
254     def _parse_options(self, parser):
255         opts, args = parser.parse_args()  <-- 1. no arg is passed

/usr/lib/python2.7/optparse.py
1361     def _get_args(self, args):
1362         if args is None:
1363             return sys.argv[1:]  <-- 3. cmdline(testr command) is read
1364         else:
1365             return args[:]

1367     def parse_args(self, args=None, values=None):
...
1381         rargs = self._get_args(args) <-- 2. args is None

Close-Bug #1241845

Change-Id: I092db96d1b6bb31c41e6ba4c5fc9606e3f8ac087
'}]
commit_message:
Include troveclient/compat/tests in testr

All tests should be included in testr.

In test_common.py, the testr command line will be read for parsing,
finally emit error message:
run.py: error: no such option: -t

we should mock the sys.argv in setUp().

The analysis is here
--------------------
troveclient/compat/common.py: CommandsBase
254     def _parse_options(self, parser):
255         opts, args = parser.parse_args()  <-- 1. no arg is passed

/usr/lib/python2.7/optparse.py
1361     def _get_args(self, args):
1362         if args is None:
1363             return sys.argv[1:]  <-- 3. cmdline(testr command) is read
1364         else:
1365             return args[:]

1367     def parse_args(self, args=None, values=None):
...
1381         rargs = self._get_args(args) <-- 2. args is None

Close-Bug #1241845

Change-Id: I092db96d1b6bb31c41e6ba4c5fc9606e3f8ac087

commit_message:
Replace g.next() with next(g)

In Python 3, g.next() has been renamed to g.__next__().
The next() buildin function will work fine for Python 2&3.

Partial implements: blueprint py33-support
Change-Id: I992d019eb180f514388f21b2400b51c94c7bdad5

subject: fixed the error when restarting quantum-server
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-15 08:25:56.000000000', 'files': ['recipes/openvswitch.rb'], 'message': "fixed the error when restarting quantum-server

When setup a network node which is not include
the quantum-server daemon by default, there will
be an error in the recipes ./openstack-network/recipes/
openvswitch.rb when retarting quantum-server service.
This error doesn't affect the whole procedure. My fixes
will check whether the quantum-server in the role-list.
It will not output the error again.

Change-Id: Iad276aaafb457add9f7829fbaf40680d70814ee4
Closes-Bug: #1231850
"}]
commit_message:
fixed the error when restarting quantum-server

When setup a network node which is not include
the quantum-server daemon by default, there will
be an error in the recipes ./openstack-network/recipes/
openvswitch.rb when retarting quantum-server service.
This error doesn't affect the whole procedure. My fixes
will check whether the quantum-server in the role-list.
It will not output the error again.

Change-Id: Iad276aaafb457add9f7829fbaf40680d70814ee4
Closes-Bug: #1231850

commit_message:
Added New Files for Vagrant Install Mode

Vagrant uses eth0 of the Virtual Machine for communicating with the
VM, manually changing the network port is not possible as Vagrant
overrides it. So change in the network interfaces is done as a work
around till we get a fix for this issue.

b/p training-manuals

Change-Id: I618058c0c5395c00fd21168ee973aca7ec68f19f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4463, 'name': 'iccha-sethi', 'email': 'iccha.sethi@rackspace.com', 'username': 'iccha-sethi'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-22 15:52:57.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Exclude iso8601 version 0.1.7

The iso8601 package had a 0.1.7 release on October 19th.
Unfortunately, it cannot be installed under Python 3.3 due to a
unicode character in its README.rst, which is read by its
setup.py.  This causes our py33 gates to fail.  The temporary
solution is to exclude 0.1.7.  As a more permanent solution, I
have reported this as a bug[1] to the iso8601 developer, which
should hopefully result in a fix.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/micktwomey/pyiso8601/issue/10/setuppy-broken-for-python-33

Change-Id: Icdd8223b26caf755c8d6cd4c27c99ecea5f54a75
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude iso8601 version 0.1.7

The iso8601 package had a 0.1.7 release on October 19th.
Unfortunately, it cannot be installed under Python 3.3 due to a
unicode character in its README.rst, which is read by its
setup.py.  This causes our py33 gates to fail.  The temporary
solution is to exclude 0.1.7.  As a more permanent solution, I
have reported this as a bug[1] to the iso8601 developer, which
should hopefully result in a fix.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/micktwomey/pyiso8601/issue/10/setuppy-broken-for-python-33

Change-Id: Icdd8223b26caf755c8d6cd4c27c99ecea5f54a75

commit_message:
Install Guide: fix ssh command

* Identity file is not mykey, but ~/.ssh/id_rsa (the default).
* CirrOS demands login as user cirros, not user root.

backport: havana
Change-Id: Ie707a7a35c98bc85993668b6d7576e99380b2bc3

commit_message:
require iso8601>=0.1.8

so, after a string of broken iso8601 releases, 0.1.8 might be the
winner. However, 0.1.4 is provided by precise, which means the
previous requirements statement won't actually test it on devstack
nodes.

Bump this puppy up to >=0.1.8 to see if this is actually going to
work for us across the board.

Change-Id: I63b0fdd0d8bb25e67b8b29af12d0940ad5b84401

0.1.7 was never actually tested with python 3.3 before this change
was made. Revert back to the pin at 0.1.4 until we *know* we have

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Unpin iso8601 but skip bad versions"

This reverts commit 27cd9c8d08a2f9eec77ef68aa3fad5acdf0e1b7d.

0.1.7 was never actually tested with python 3.3 before this change
was made. Revert back to the pin at 0.1.4 until we *know* we have
a good working version.

Change-Id: I8949e1fce26aab783c117ce389db3a4066d5348f

subject: Apply six for metaclass
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-18 05:22:32.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/base.py'], 'message': 'Apply six for metaclass

The way to using metaclass has changed in Python3.

Python 2.7 way:

class Foo(object):
  __metaclass__ = FooMeta

Python 3 way:

class Foo(object, metaclass=FooMeta):
  ...

The six.add_metaclass() decorator allows us to use one syntax that
works for both Python 2.7 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Ibd31a9f91bac6ec220d802f16c77ee0306e211b3
Closes-Bug: #1236648
'}]
commit_message:
Apply six for metaclass

The way to using metaclass has changed in Python3.

Python 2.7 way:

class Foo(object):
  __metaclass__ = FooMeta

Python 3 way:

class Foo(object, metaclass=FooMeta):
  ...

The six.add_metaclass() decorator allows us to use one syntax that
works for both Python 2.7 and Python 3.

Change-Id: Ibd31a9f91bac6ec220d802f16c77ee0306e211b3
Closes-Bug: #1236648

DeletableSubnet._router_ids was defined as a static attribute, causing

commit_message:
fix DeletableSubnet in api/network/common

DeletableSubnet._router_ids was defined as a static attribute, causing
errors on tearDown working with multiple {router,subnet} couples as it
tries to disconnect subnet from all routers existing instead of all
routers connected to it

Change-Id: Id446d7bb2be117ea56b52e6a644b259089cdc158

subject: add bash8 tool (like pep8, but way hackier)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-14 20:19:28.000000000', 'files': ['tools/bash8.py'], 'message': "add bash8 tool (like pep8, but way hackier)

unlike our python code, we have no automatic style checking for
bash. For the most part, it's not a big deal, but errant whitespace
or incorrect indenting is sometimes annoying to have to -1 people's
patches for. Instead of constantly picking it up in manual review
maybe we can do better.

This is an uber hacky script which could be used to do just that.

   ./tools/bash8.py file1 file2 file3 ...

And it will show issues found with the files at hand. Lightly
tested in the existing devstack tree, it exposes a few issues that
we might want to think about.

This should be python 3 compatible, and includes argparse to provide
a basic '-h' support to explain how the command should be run.

Change-Id: I5009fa5852595c2953a548e430e5e1ce06ae94e0
"}]
commit_message:
add bash8 tool (like pep8, but way hackier)

unlike our python code, we have no automatic style checking for
bash. For the most part, it's not a big deal, but errant whitespace
or incorrect indenting is sometimes annoying to have to -1 people's
patches for. Instead of constantly picking it up in manual review
maybe we can do better.

This is an uber hacky script which could be used to do just that.

   ./tools/bash8.py file1 file2 file3 ...

And it will show issues found with the files at hand. Lightly
tested in the existing devstack tree, it exposes a few issues that
we might want to think about.

This should be python 3 compatible, and includes argparse to provide
a basic '-h' support to explain how the command should be run.

Change-Id: I5009fa5852595c2953a548e430e5e1ce06ae94e0

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-10-23 05:53:31.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest.sh'], 'message': 'Add env var for choosing of deploy image element

Make sure we can easily switch between deploy and
deploy-kexec image elements when building a deploy
ramdisk by setting the environment variable.

Default to deploy, because deploy-kexec is not reliable
right now and our production-like cloud (TripleOCloud)
has switched to deploy.

Change-Id: Ia9dc58a5de6a7677824eebc82d13888355378b77
'}]
commit_message:
Add env var for choosing of deploy image element

Make sure we can easily switch between deploy and
deploy-kexec image elements when building a deploy
ramdisk by setting the environment variable.

Default to deploy, because deploy-kexec is not reliable
right now and our production-like cloud (TripleOCloud)
has switched to deploy.

Change-Id: Ia9dc58a5de6a7677824eebc82d13888355378b77

commit_message:
Remove deprecated libvirt VIF driver code

Libvirt vif specific driver classes have been replaced by a generic
driver LibvirtGenericVIFDriver and are deprecated in Havana, so we
can remove them safely.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icecb3c9aa4282c511364107d87f8aba517a5ae14
Closes-Bug: 1235036

commit_message:
Replace tests.base part1

It is the first step to replace using ceilometer.tests.base with
openstack.common.test.
Displacement method assertTimestampEqual() from TestCase to
BaseTestCase class in base.py because TestCase
will not be used in the future.

This patch fixes the invalid tag name error when k:v type
tagname appears in response of api during xml serialization,
the tagname which contains colon couldn't be supported by
default since it is reserved by xml namespace, this patch

Change-Id: Ib20efb378425cbe5deef45fbac561955cbe0f7bc

commit_message:
Fixes Invalid tag name error when using k:v tagname

This patch fixes the invalid tag name error when k:v type
tagname appears in response of api during xml serialization,
the tagname which contains colon couldn't be supported by
default since it is reserved by xml namespace, this patch
solve it by adding the k of k:v tagname into namespace.

Fixes bug: #1213927

Change-Id: Ib20efb378425cbe5deef45fbac561955cbe0f7bc

subject: xenapi: ephemeral disk partition should fill disk
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-18 17:32:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py'], 'message': 'xenapi: ephemeral disk partition should fill disk

The current code looks to specify the expected start and finish values
for the partition. A unit miss match between what nova and parted count
as a GB seem to cause the difference.

As we just want to fill the whole disk, we can pass "-0" as the end
value, to tell parted to extend the partition to the end of the disk.

Fixes bug 1241734
Change-Id: Ie4753d9de1e20561b8f96360e879075498a5ef58
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: ephemeral disk partition should fill disk

The current code looks to specify the expected start and finish values
for the partition. A unit miss match between what nova and parted count
as a GB seem to cause the difference.

As we just want to fill the whole disk, we can pass "-0" as the end
value, to tell parted to extend the partition to the end of the disk.

Fixes bug 1241734
Change-Id: Ie4753d9de1e20561b8f96360e879075498a5ef58

nova.disk.api.mkfs will use nova.utils.mkfs,
unless an arbitrary mkfs command has been provided by the user.
Preserving the default filesystem to be used for each os_type.

Also, adding run_as_root parameter to utils.mkfs, to allow it
handle block devices.

Change-Id: I3ca21e0ee80caa7e1152ebae56d73ed3c14844c0
'}]
commit_message:
Merging two mkfs commands.

nova.disk.api.mkfs will use nova.utils.mkfs,
unless an arbitrary mkfs command has been provided by the user.
Preserving the default filesystem to be used for each os_type.

Also, adding run_as_root parameter to utils.mkfs, to allow it
handle block devices.

Change-Id: I3ca21e0ee80caa7e1152ebae56d73ed3c14844c0

subject: Add V2 rpc api for consoleauth
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-10-16 21:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/consoleauth/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/consoleauth/rpcapi.py', 'nova/consoleauth/manager.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py'], 'message': 'Add V2 rpc api for consoleauth

Add support for the 2.0 consoleauth rpc API.  This commit retains
compatibility with the older 1.X API to allow continuous deployment
without any downtime.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continuous deployment should follow
this process to upgrade without any downtime with the consoleauth
service:

    1) Sync all consoleauth services to this commit, so that they handle
       both new and old messages.

    2) Upgrade everything else to this commit so that all clients start
       sending the new messages.

    3) Upgrade past this, where support for the old messages will be
       dropped.

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: Iad71d3c2801f9355968e69bce3308b84f922b239
'}]
commit_message:
Add V2 rpc api for consoleauth

Add support for the 2.0 consoleauth rpc API.  This commit retains
compatibility with the older 1.X API to allow continuous deployment
without any downtime.

UpgradeImpact - Deployments doing continuous deployment should follow
this process to upgrade without any downtime with the consoleauth
service:

    1) Sync all consoleauth services to this commit, so that they handle
       both new and old messages.

    2) Upgrade everything else to this commit so that all clients start
       sending the new messages.

    3) Upgrade past this, where support for the old messages will be
       dropped.

Part of blueprint rpc-major-version-updates-icehouse

Change-Id: Iad71d3c2801f9355968e69bce3308b84f922b239

subject: Revert "remove cinder-rtstool because of rtslib dep"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-21 19:07:31.000000000', 'files': ['bin/cinder-rtstool'], 'message': 'Revert "remove cinder-rtstool because of rtslib dep"

This reverts commit b66c3361be2095186e19b0d44e49a8b2c48f7235.

Dependencies of this code (rtslib-fb) are now Apache-licensed,
which resolves the previous issue with this code being in-tree.

This patch is a direct revert, other patches will follow to
line up changes that have occurred between b66c336 and now.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

Blueprint: lio-rtslib

Change-Id: I14786bddf419d98ff7c468b185462f5387dbbba1
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "remove cinder-rtstool because of rtslib dep"

This reverts commit b66c3361be2095186e19b0d44e49a8b2c48f7235.

Dependencies of this code (rtslib-fb) are now Apache-licensed,
which resolves the previous issue with this code being in-tree.

This patch is a direct revert, other patches will follow to
line up changes that have occurred between b66c336 and now.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

Blueprint: lio-rtslib

Change-Id: I14786bddf419d98ff7c468b185462f5387dbbba1

commit_message:
Nexenta drivers ignore "does not exist" exception

Ignore "does not exist" exception in NFS and iSCSI driver,
delete_volume and delete_snapshot methods.
This exceptions means that the volume or the snapshot not exists in the
backend, so we can avoid "delete" errors, when the resource was already
deleted.

Closes-Bug: 1240650
Change-Id: I3b2684097dcb95ba50a67c94a353dc3f17374777

commit_message:
Allow users to change their own email address

Adds a new dashboard to change own email address.

Users without admin rights can't get their current email address
thus the corresponding form field is empty, but a successful
change displays the new email address in the modal popup.

Closes-Bug: #884492
Change-Id: I5aa63caf6a1f4d4b1a89d18519600b091591f3ab

commit_message:
Returns an extra UUID field in baremetal node responses.

In order to use force_node functionality.  Clients must specify:
--availability_zone=zone:<host>:node_uuid

Right now the Baremetal Node UUID is not returned via any API call
and thus there is no way for the client to discover it. This patch
returns an extra UUID field in Nova Baremetal Node API responses.

Partial-Bug #1184449

Change-Id: I46abc121cd3bb5466aa78e576ce8e7a620943807

subject: Allow user to specify instance resume behaviour on host reboot
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 1865, 'name': 'Andrea Rosa', 'email': 'andrea.rosa@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-rosa-m'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4468, 'name': 'Wangpan', 'email': 'hzwangpan@corp.netease.com', 'username': 'hzwangpan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2013-07-09 17:00:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/api/openstack/fakes.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/197_add_resume_on_reboot_to_instances.py', 'nova/compute/resume_on_host_reboot.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_server_start_stop.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Allow user to specify instance resume behaviour on host reboot

The configuration option resume_guests_state_on_host_boot defines
a global policy on whether or not to restart instances when a host
reboots.  Because a host may be down for a significant period of
time many cloud applications monitor their own instances and launch
replacements restarting all instances is rarely the required behaviour

The blueprint provides the user with a mechanism to specify the
resume policy on a per instance basis.

Supported values are:
  Default -  use system configuration value (current behaviour)
  Never   -  Don't resume this instance
  Always  -  Always resume this instance

This is the first part of the blueprint which implements the resume
decision.   The API extension will be provided in a separate commit

Code is structured to allow a futher option of "Resume only if host
has been down for less than xxx seconds" - but we need support from
the ServiceGroup API for that.

Partly implements bp: user-defined-resume

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1f2969a9a32f8bf7c6b52ef76a7e2ac54e17554d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow user to specify instance resume behaviour on host reboot

The configuration option resume_guests_state_on_host_boot defines
a global policy on whether or not to restart instances when a host
reboots.  Because a host may be down for a significant period of
time many cloud applications monitor their own instances and launch
replacements restarting all instances is rarely the required behaviour

The blueprint provides the user with a mechanism to specify the
resume policy on a per instance basis.

Supported values are:
  Default -  use system configuration value (current behaviour)
  Never   -  Don't resume this instance
  Always  -  Always resume this instance

This is the first part of the blueprint which implements the resume
decision.   The API extension will be provided in a separate commit

Code is structured to allow a futher option of "Resume only if host
has been down for less than xxx seconds" - but we need support from
the ServiceGroup API for that.

Partly implements bp: user-defined-resume

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1f2969a9a32f8bf7c6b52ef76a7e2ac54e17554d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-08-19 20:48:41.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/003_add_disk_format.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/009_add_mindisk_and_minram.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/schema.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/007_add_owner.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/010_default_update_at.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/004_add_checksum.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/005_size_big_integer.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/002_add_image_properties_table.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/006_key_to_name.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/008_add_image_members_table.py'], 'message': 'Remove from_migration_import() and use autoload=True instead

Many of the older database migrations used an awkward method of loading
the schema of a table from a previous migration. This has caused at least
one bug where a column was missing by accident.

Manually writing out the schema turns out to be unnecessary since
SQLAlchemy has a way to load the existing schema from the database with
the autoload=True parameter. In fact all of the migrations beyond 010
do this already.

Change-Id: I303710479ebb617495cd834777963d8dfcc01f54
'}]
commit_message:
Remove from_migration_import() and use autoload=True instead

Many of the older database migrations used an awkward method of loading
the schema of a table from a previous migration. This has caused at least
one bug where a column was missing by accident.

Manually writing out the schema turns out to be unnecessary since
SQLAlchemy has a way to load the existing schema from the database with
the autoload=True parameter. In fact all of the migrations beyond 010
do this already.

Change-Id: I303710479ebb617495cd834777963d8dfcc01f54

subject: nova-network: make sure bridge device is up on creating vlan
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-09-29 11:13:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': "nova-network: make sure bridge device is up on creating vlan

Currently, nova-network would create vlan device automatically if
it doesn't exist on host. However, on creating vlan device, nova
just makes sure the newly created vlan device is up, but not bridge
interface. Thus, the vlan device is left on M-DOWN state on this
situation, and instance network is not accessable.

This patch fixes this problem by setting bridge interface up before
creating vlan device, vlan device is always up after being created.

Bug 1232699

Change-Id: If3b2f26e84505b27aa5d0ce264d7e05118cbf584
"}]
commit_message:
nova-network: make sure bridge device is up on creating vlan

Currently, nova-network would create vlan device automatically if
it doesn't exist on host. However, on creating vlan device, nova
just makes sure the newly created vlan device is up, but not bridge
interface. Thus, the vlan device is left on M-DOWN state on this
situation, and instance network is not accessable.

This patch fixes this problem by setting bridge interface up before
creating vlan device, vlan device is always up after being created.

Bug 1232699

Change-Id: If3b2f26e84505b27aa5d0ce264d7e05118cbf584

Refactor keystone_endpoint to use prefetch and flush paradigms.

commit_message:
NetApp fix mirrored stats

This fixes the incorrect reporting of mirrorred
statistics for NetApp iscsi and nfs backend.
The uninitialized and broken snapmirror is
not reported and only snapmirrored state
is reported back.

Closes-Bug:#1242808

Change-Id: I4b9f788e1f99b78d12db23bd92b6a277d5f64cb3

commit_message:
Expose additional status in baremetal API extension

Add fields: uuid, task_state, updated_at, and pxe_config_path
to aid system admins in troubleshooting issues.

Fixes bug 1184449

Change-Id: Ia4c03cb228b3efe602455bf05883ddf03b7f18da

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-10-16 12:18:40.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/agents.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/agents.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_agents.py', 'nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_agents.py'], 'message': 'Validate parameters of agent API

The agent API has some parameters, but they are not validated.
Each parameter is stored to the table "agent_builds", and each column
is defined as varchar(255).

mysql> desc agent_builds;
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| Field        | Type         | Null | Key | Default | Extra          |
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| created_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| updated_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| deleted_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| id           | int(11)      | NO   | PRI | NULL    | auto_increment |
| hypervisor   | varchar(255) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |                |
| os           | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| architecture | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| version      | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| url          | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| md5hash      | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| deleted      | int(11)      | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

This patch adds the validation with the type and the length.

Closes-Bug: 1240458

Change-Id: Id06235ebde62f7b96c55b0bd2be5d941bfd2e999
'}]
commit_message:
Validate parameters of agent API

The agent API has some parameters, but they are not validated.
Each parameter is stored to the table "agent_builds", and each column
is defined as varchar(255).

mysql> desc agent_builds;
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| Field        | Type         | Null | Key | Default | Extra          |
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+
| created_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| updated_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| deleted_at   | datetime     | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| id           | int(11)      | NO   | PRI | NULL    | auto_increment |
| hypervisor   | varchar(255) | YES  | MUL | NULL    |                |
| os           | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| architecture | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| version      | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| url          | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| md5hash      | varchar(255) | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
| deleted      | int(11)      | YES  |     | NULL    |                |
+--------------+--------------+------+-----+---------+----------------+

This patch adds the validation with the type and the length.

Closes-Bug: 1240458

Change-Id: Id06235ebde62f7b96c55b0bd2be5d941bfd2e999

subject: Let OFFLINE=True work when installing pip
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-19 04:52:45.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_pip.sh'], 'message': 'Let OFFLINE=True work when installing pip

Closes-Bug: #1241923

When OFFLINE=True, we should check if the system has the right pip.
If the pip is of the right version, the install pip sh exit.
If the pip is not of the right version and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.
If the system has no pip installed at all and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.

Change-Id: I094e6ded29d0053e9b97cb82791c4bee56d095b9
'}]
commit_message:
Let OFFLINE=True work when installing pip

Closes-Bug: #1241923

When OFFLINE=True, we should check if the system has the right pip.
If the pip is of the right version, the install pip sh exit.
If the pip is not of the right version and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.
If the system has no pip installed at all and OFFLINE is True, the sh
complains and exits.

Change-Id: I094e6ded29d0053e9b97cb82791c4bee56d095b9

commit_message:
Uses oslo.imageutils

Commit 035668 had the QemuImgInfo class moved to Oslo.
This class was copied from Nova to Cinder and diverged since then.
The two projects will be able to use identical classes by importing imageutils.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-10-08 08:38:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-resize.json', 'nova/tests/integrated/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-resize.json.tpl', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/servers.py', 'nova/tests/integrated/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-confirm-resize.xml.tpl', 'doc/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-confirm-resize.json', 'nova/tests/integrated/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-confirm-resize.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/integrated/v3/test_servers.py', 'nova/tests/integrated/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-resize.xml.tpl', 'doc/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-resize.xml', 'doc/v3/api_samples/servers/server-action-confirm-resize.xml'], 'message': "Fix status code of server's action confirm_resize for v3

The status code of confirm_resize should be 202, but it
returns 204 now. That because it returns HTTPNoContent
that overwrites the status code of decorator 'wsgi.response(202)'

And adds API samples for confirm_resize that used to test

Change-Id: I50a3046866af0a1efdb5c41ded40f973b02843e8

commit_message:
Fix status code of server's action confirm_resize for v3

The status code of confirm_resize should be 202, but it
returns 204 now. That because it returns HTTPNoContent
that overwrites the status code of decorator 'wsgi.response(202)'

And adds API samples for confirm_resize that used to test
the status code of confirm_resize.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-unittests
Closes-bug: #1233561

Change-Id: I50a3046866af0a1efdb5c41ded40f973b02843e8

commit_message:
Decreasing integration test for cluster configs

Earlier integration test for cluster configs and Swift did the same step: check Swift availability.
Now test for Swift was deleted from test for cluster configs.
Swift availability is checked only in test for Swift.

We used to ignore optional task arguments (arguments of 'execute' method
with default value). With this change flow author can pass such
arguments to task by mentioning them in 'requires' and/or 'rebind'
task constructor parameters.

Change-Id: Ib92f87eb05623d30db6f1691d75c11376d45c87a
"}]
commit_message:
Support for optional task arguments

We used to ignore optional task arguments (arguments of 'execute' method
with default value). With this change flow author can pass such
arguments to task by mentioning them in 'requires' and/or 'rebind'
task constructor parameters.

Change-Id: Ib92f87eb05623d30db6f1691d75c11376d45c87a

commit_message:
exit cleanup in functions

we should always use die instead of exit so that we know why we
failed.

Also remove instances where exit is called after die, as that is
a noop.

commit_message:
Use isolation credentials for neutron api tests

This commit just adds the use of isolated credentials to the neutron
api tests if tenant isolation is enabled. Previously the neutron
tests would all run in the same tenant regardless of the config
option.

Change-Id: Ide9c4a3ed543b917bd401561c601f9897bd7db50

subject: Add WWW-Authenticate to 401 responses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@gmail.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6198, 'name': 'Peter Portante', 'email': 'peter.a.portante@gmail.com', 'username': 'peter-a-portante'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2013-10-22 14:49:46.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempauth.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_formpost.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_keystoneauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py', 'swift/common/middleware/formpost.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py', 'swift/common/swob.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py'], 'message': 'Add WWW-Authenticate to 401 responses

Per http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt, when a 401 error is returned, the
Www-Authenticate response header MUST also be returned. The format is
described in http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2617.txt.

Swift supports and/or implements a number of authentication schemes
including tempauth, Keystone, tempurl, formpost and container sync. In
this fix, we use a catch-all, "Swift". The realm is the account (where
known) or "unknown" (bad path or where the 401 is returned from code
that does not have the request). Examples:

     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="AUTH_1234567889"
     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="unknown"

Fixes bug #1215491

Change-Id: I03362789318dfa156d3733ef9348795062a9cfc4
'}]
commit_message:
Add WWW-Authenticate to 401 responses

Per http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2616.txt, when a 401 error is returned, the
Www-Authenticate response header MUST also be returned. The format is
described in http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2617.txt.

Swift supports and/or implements a number of authentication schemes
including tempauth, Keystone, tempurl, formpost and container sync. In
this fix, we use a catch-all, "Swift". The realm is the account (where
known) or "unknown" (bad path or where the 401 is returned from code
that does not have the request). Examples:

     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="AUTH_1234567889"
     Www-Authenticate: Swift realm="unknown"

Fixes bug #1215491

Change-Id: I03362789318dfa156d3733ef9348795062a9cfc4

volume is not running with root permission.

commit_message:
Drop auth_token configs for api-paste.ini.

We now prefer to use cinder.conf to configure keystoneclients
auth_token configs.

Also, Devstack has now been update to allow this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52259/

Related-Bug #1240753

Change-Id: I2a4b300af37eddf5010b97ca796f0552941642a8

commit_message:
Make cells info_cache updates more tolerant

Allow lists or network models to be passed in for
instance['info_cache']['network_info'] in cells updates.  Ultimately
these messages will become more consistent when fully converted to objects.

Change-Id: Ifd46a3060418b3e2e4073c3b232937a18a225f99
Closes-bug: 1240730

commit_message:
server status remained in unexpected state

Two test case in the test_servers_negative change the 'one' servers
into a stable not active state. We are waiting 2 times 400 sec for
getting active state in vain.
Having those test cases to restore the expected state.

The deleted server related rebuild and reboot test case create are
merged and it creates and deletes one server.

Closes-Bug: #1241588

Change-Id: Ie1b9dc62bad2bf7b8595da2c9d6f994c646a0025
(cherry picked from commit 6fab1a1540ec9c38413b1a028bb367b849fa4038)

subject: Fix printing of keys with non-string values
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-22 15:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['os_apply_config/tests/test_apply_config.py', 'os_apply_config/apply_config.py'], 'message': "Fix printing of keys with non-string values

When trying to print a key which has a non-string value
(e.g. bool or int), TypeError exception is raised. This
is caused by the fact, that ensure_type() function accepts
string values, but parsed values are passed (i.e. False
instead of 'False' or 12 instead of '12' and so on).

Change-Id: I10f5e60994bc34288f15af07d2d255ace3755b57
Closes-Bug: #1243263
"}]
commit_message:
Fix printing of keys with non-string values

When trying to print a key which has a non-string value
(e.g. bool or int), TypeError exception is raised. This
is caused by the fact, that ensure_type() function accepts
string values, but parsed values are passed (i.e. False
instead of 'False' or 12 instead of '12' and so on).

Change-Id: I10f5e60994bc34288f15af07d2d255ace3755b57
Closes-Bug: #1243263

commit_message:
Install Guide: Don't use obsolete sql_connection

For neutron and ceilometer, sql_connection is deprecated use
instead:
[database]
connection

Fixes some wrong format connection strings.

Also, reconnect_interval is deprecated in favor of retry_interval

Change-Id: Ieb72349bafcbd1795d64f832d64fdbce695147bf
Backport: stable/havana
Partial-Bug: #1243131
Closes-Bug: #1205060

subject: Do not erase task progress details
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-10-18 08:37:02.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/task_action.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_progress.py'], 'message': 'Do not erase task progress details

Before this change we used to loose any progress details set by task
when it was updating its progress when task state was changed from
RUNNING to SUCCESS (and thus progress forced to 1.0). This commit
fixes this, so that when progress is updated from the engine latest
progress details are preserved.

Breaking change: to allow details to be associated with progress
value they were set for we save progress and then return progress
value with details.

Change-Id: Ic90e61ee3dcf62731696a0f10134bc448e7d6384
'}]
commit_message:
Do not erase task progress details

Before this change we used to loose any progress details set by task
when it was updating its progress when task state was changed from
RUNNING to SUCCESS (and thus progress forced to 1.0). This commit
fixes this, so that when progress is updated from the engine latest
progress details are preserved.

Breaking change: to allow details to be associated with progress
value they were set for we save progress and then return progress
value with details.

Change-Id: Ic90e61ee3dcf62731696a0f10134bc448e7d6384

subject: Remove AWS style syntax from HOT templates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-22 08:15:45.000000000', 'files': ['hot/F18/NovaInstanceWithCinderVolume_Native.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove AWS style syntax from HOT templates

This patch removed AWS style syntax from samples in the heat-templates
repository to not advocate their use in future HOT templates.

The current HOT template parser in the engine uses a camel case to snake case
conversion but this is going to be removed in favor of strict HOT keyword
checking. Therefore, we do not want to advocate syntax in HOT templates that
will break in the future.

Change-Id: I2aab31b64c863d2a62d3c7e57c0fb983419c3186
'}]
commit_message:
Remove AWS style syntax from HOT templates

This patch removed AWS style syntax from samples in the heat-templates
repository to not advocate their use in future HOT templates.

The current HOT template parser in the engine uses a camel case to snake case
conversion but this is going to be removed in favor of strict HOT keyword
checking. Therefore, we do not want to advocate syntax in HOT templates that
will break in the future.

Change-Id: I2aab31b64c863d2a62d3c7e57c0fb983419c3186

subject: Faster swift-dispersion-populate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-05 23:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['doc/manpages/swift-dispersion-populate.1', 'bin/swift-dispersion-populate', 'etc/dispersion.conf-sample'], 'message': "Faster swift-dispersion-populate

- Makes swift-dispersion-populate a bit faster when using a larger
  dispersion_coverage with a larger part_power.
- Adds option to only run population for container OR objects
- Adds option to let you resume population at given point (useful if you
  need to resume population after a previous run error'd out or the
  like) by specifying which suffix to start at.

The original populate just randomly used uuid4().hex as a suffix on the
container/object names until all the partition's required where covered.
This isn't a big deal if you're only doing 1% coverage on a ring with a
small part power but takes ages if you're doing 100% on a larger ring.

Change-Id: I52f890a774412c1d6179f12db9081aedc58b6bc2
"}]
commit_message:
Faster swift-dispersion-populate

- Makes swift-dispersion-populate a bit faster when using a larger
  dispersion_coverage with a larger part_power.
- Adds option to only run population for container OR objects
- Adds option to let you resume population at given point (useful if you
  need to resume population after a previous run error'd out or the
  like) by specifying which suffix to start at.

The original populate just randomly used uuid4().hex as a suffix on the
container/object names until all the partition's required where covered.
This isn't a big deal if you're only doing 1% coverage on a ring with a
small part power but takes ages if you're doing 100% on a larger ring.

Change-Id: I52f890a774412c1d6179f12db9081aedc58b6bc2

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2013-10-21 19:07:09.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py', 'keystone/token/provider.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': 'Implementation of opt-out from catalog data during token validation.

The additional query parameter nocatalog in GET /v3/auth/tokens allows
the requestor to receive a token response omitting the catalog data.
This makes the token response sensibly smaller in case the catalog is
large due to the vaste deployment environment and available services.

e.g. GET /v3/auth/tokens?nocatalog

blueprint token-valid-catalog-opt-out

Change-Id: I272b1282acc0f04565d88c51b87dc7e30b141b7c
'}]
commit_message:
Implementation of opt-out from catalog data during token validation.

The additional query parameter nocatalog in GET /v3/auth/tokens allows
the requestor to receive a token response omitting the catalog data.
This makes the token response sensibly smaller in case the catalog is
large due to the vaste deployment environment and available services.

e.g. GET /v3/auth/tokens?nocatalog

blueprint token-valid-catalog-opt-out

Change-Id: I272b1282acc0f04565d88c51b87dc7e30b141b7c

subject: Be more patient with IPMI and BMC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-17 19:49:01.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/drivers/test_ipmitool.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ipmitool.py'], 'message': "Be more patient with IPMI and BMC

Before the ipmitool driver called 'power status; power on' in a loop
which made the IPMI/BMCs not behave well.  Also the total time we would
wait (5 seconds) wasn't always enough.  So make sure power on/off is
only called once and wait up to 10 seconds for the power state change to
go into effect.

This is a port of change-id I5a4d7c84ebdf9c1f7d8d0570dbc31764c31f1fc6

Change-Id: I50982b24e5443b34d5597581ea2947a0301d35c9
Closes-Bug: #1234479
"}]
commit_message:
Be more patient with IPMI and BMC

Before the ipmitool driver called 'power status; power on' in a loop
which made the IPMI/BMCs not behave well.  Also the total time we would
wait (5 seconds) wasn't always enough.  So make sure power on/off is
only called once and wait up to 10 seconds for the power state change to
go into effect.

This is a port of change-id I5a4d7c84ebdf9c1f7d8d0570dbc31764c31f1fc6

Change-Id: I50982b24e5443b34d5597581ea2947a0301d35c9
Closes-Bug: #1234479

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 616, 'name': 'Mark Washenberger', 'email': 'mark.washenberger@markwash.net', 'username': 'markwash'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6549, 'name': 'Zhi Yan Liu', 'email': 'lzy.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'lzy-dev'}, {'_account_id': 7531, 'name': 'Sridevi Koushik', 'email': 'sridevi.koushik@rackspace.com', 'username': 'sridevik'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-21 17:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Raise iso8601 requirement

iso8601-0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "2011-09-05". This behavior is
different than iso8601-0.1.4, so caused glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API
controller provide different result.

Raise iso8601 requirement to >=0.1.7 will ask glance-{api,registry}'s v1
API provided consistent result to end user.

See bug #1242501 for details.

Related-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Change-Id: Ie6f3026b519e62e788a253b5caa6eeb5ddc245a6
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>'}]
commit_message:
Raise iso8601 requirement

iso8601-0.1.7 "parse_date()" could successfully handle datestring param
which missing the time part like "2011-09-05". This behavior is
different than iso8601-0.1.4, so caused glance-{api,registry}'s v1 API
controller provide different result.

Raise iso8601 requirement to >=0.1.7 will ask glance-{api,registry}'s v1
API provided consistent result to end user.

See bug #1242501 for details.

Related-Id: I2625eb3888111829a9da4d093b34193b8795f264
Change-Id: Ie6f3026b519e62e788a253b5caa6eeb5ddc245a6
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Change six to match global requirements

Pinning six to <1.4.0 causes failurs for anyone trying to use six to
port urlparse code. It also does not match with global requirements.

subject: add each role for each network main component
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-16 13:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['roles/os-network-openvswitch.rb', 'roles/os-network-l3-agent.rb', 'roles/os-network-server.rb', 'roles/os-network-dhcp-agent.rb'], 'message': "add each role for each network main component

In typical openstack configuration, there may be 3 types nodes:
controller node, network node, and compute node. From the network
point, it's always supposed that: the Quantum Server is on the
controller node; and the L2 agent, DHCP agent and L3 agent are on
the network node; the L2 agent are on the compute node. We need the
each role for each OpenStack network main component. This will make
the configuration more flexible. So I add them here.

Change-Id: Ida4826c6dfe770b58790d75561bea42e9584ca89
Closes-Bug: #1240509
"}]
commit_message:
add each role for each network main component

In typical openstack configuration, there may be 3 types nodes:
controller node, network node, and compute node. From the network
point, it's always supposed that: the Quantum Server is on the
controller node; and the L2 agent, DHCP agent and L3 agent are on
the network node; the L2 agent are on the compute node. We need the
each role for each OpenStack network main component. This will make
the configuration more flexible. So I add them here.

Change-Id: Ida4826c6dfe770b58790d75561bea42e9584ca89
Closes-Bug: #1240509

subject: Guess the group name for Lazily registered options
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-10-22 15:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/config/generator.py'], 'message': "Guess the group name for Lazily registered options

securemessage.py for example lazily registers options into the
'secure_messages' group. Current code in generator assumes that all
registration is done on the global CONF. In this review, we relax
that a bit and looks if there is only and only one OptGroup is
in the module as well and assumes that there would be a lazy
registration of the options into that OptGroup sometime later.

Partial-bug #1241634

Change-Id: I8aaa1267e32fd1080318031945fd0f7594bd6250
"}]
commit_message:
Guess the group name for Lazily registered options

securemessage.py for example lazily registers options into the
'secure_messages' group. Current code in generator assumes that all
registration is done on the global CONF. In this review, we relax
that a bit and looks if there is only and only one OptGroup is
in the module as well and assumes that there would be a lazy
registration of the options into that OptGroup sometime later.

Partial-bug #1241634

Change-Id: I8aaa1267e32fd1080318031945fd0f7594bd6250

subject: feat(shard): queue listing
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2013-10-21 22:17:15.000000000', 'files': ['marconi/queues/storage/utils.py', 'marconi/queues/storage/sharding.py', 'tests/unit/queues/transport/wsgi/test_queue_lifecycle.py', 'tests/unit/queues/storage/test_shard_queues.py'], 'message': 'feat(shard): queue listing

Sharding need special storage driver wrapper for queue-related
operations.  The listing queue algorithm merge the listing result
from multiple storage connections, and return them in sorted order.

Note that currently the sharding implementation only returns one
storage connection, and the algorithms does not run asynchronously
yet (since there is no way to test).

Change-Id: I1fbf9c79cd49579150e4a6cd12a1d0a542d6ea7a
'}]
commit_message:
feat(shard): queue listing

Sharding need special storage driver wrapper for queue-related
operations.  The listing queue algorithm merge the listing result
from multiple storage connections, and return them in sorted order.

Note that currently the sharding implementation only returns one
storage connection, and the algorithms does not run asynchronously
yet (since there is no way to test).

Change-Id: I1fbf9c79cd49579150e4a6cd12a1d0a542d6ea7a

commit_message:
Fix wrong using of Metadata in 15,16 migrations

In up>down>up mode migrations are failing due to using of common MetaData.
It should be declared separatly for both of migration methods.

Fixes-Bug: #1240898
Change-Id: I8f6555ce44204e79a9c47b7caa1fe05970f4e3f0

subject: Fix remove role assignment adds role using LDAP assignment
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-22 12:28:08.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': "Fix remove role assignment adds role using LDAP assignment

When using the LDAP assignment backend, attempting to remove a
role assignment when the role hadn't been used before would
actually add the role assignment and would not return a
404 Not Found like the SQL backend.

This change makes it so that when attempt to remove a role that
wasn't assigned then 404 Not Found is returned.

Closes-Bug: #1242855
Change-Id: I28ccd26cc4bb1a241d0363d0ab52d2c11410e8b3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix remove role assignment adds role using LDAP assignment

When using the LDAP assignment backend, attempting to remove a
role assignment when the role hadn't been used before would
actually add the role assignment and would not return a
404 Not Found like the SQL backend.

This change makes it so that when attempt to remove a role that
wasn't assigned then 404 Not Found is returned.

Closes-Bug: #1242855
Change-Id: I28ccd26cc4bb1a241d0363d0ab52d2c11410e8b3

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Adapting assertIn will enhance the readability
of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Ib44d57e75238691234c5290d13c54c526a6ae64b
"}]
commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/etc

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Adapting assertIn will enhance the readability
of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Ib44d57e75238691234c5290d13c54c526a6ae64b

function. This will be used for upgrade testing so that we can
arrange for a nova-compute running on a different version of the
code to be running alongside the rest of the stack.

subject: Manage None value for the 'os_type' property
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1501, 'name': 'Phil Day', 'email': 'philip.day@hp.com', 'username': 'philip-day'}, {'_account_id': 1706, 'name': 'Tom Hancock', 'email': 'tom.hancock@hp.com', 'username': 'tom-hancock'}, {'_account_id': 1865, 'name': 'Andrea Rosa', 'email': 'andrea.rosa@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-rosa-m'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 7133, 'name': 'Ryan Moore', 'email': 'ryan.moore@hpe.com', 'username': 'moory'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-16 15:27:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Manage None value for the 'os_type' property

The I2bab617f6c1e8866650ca7dc5178b640738c9ae6 introduced a way to pass the
'os_type' property to glance when we are doing a snapshot in the libvirt
driver. Currently the code doesn't manage properly the None value for this
property and so None value is passed to glance which creates an image with
a property called 'os_type' with value 'None'.
As results of that all instances booted from a snapshot with this property will
have None value in the os_type field.
That field is used to create file name for backing images for ephemeral disks.
Now consider this scenario:
we boot an instance from an image without the os_type property defined and
with an ephemeral disk of 50 G
the resulting backing file will be called ephemeral_50_default.
At this point we take a snapshot from that instance and we boot a new instance
using this snapshot, and because of this bug we will have a new backing file
called ephemeral_50_None.
That is bad because is leaking resources in the host.

Please note that I did a small refactor of the code to make my change testable.

Change-Id: I40bca2732ee2c911344e9d361612007da1c7c3cf
Closes-bug: #1240542
"}]
commit_message:
Manage None value for the 'os_type' property

The I2bab617f6c1e8866650ca7dc5178b640738c9ae6 introduced a way to pass the
'os_type' property to glance when we are doing a snapshot in the libvirt
driver. Currently the code doesn't manage properly the None value for this
property and so None value is passed to glance which creates an image with
a property called 'os_type' with value 'None'.
As results of that all instances booted from a snapshot with this property will
have None value in the os_type field.
That field is used to create file name for backing images for ephemeral disks.
Now consider this scenario:
we boot an instance from an image without the os_type property defined and
with an ephemeral disk of 50 G
the resulting backing file will be called ephemeral_50_default.
At this point we take a snapshot from that instance and we boot a new instance
using this snapshot, and because of this bug we will have a new backing file
called ephemeral_50_None.
That is bad because is leaking resources in the host.

Please note that I did a small refactor of the code to make my change testable.

Change-Id: I40bca2732ee2c911344e9d361612007da1c7c3cf
Closes-bug: #1240542

subject: Remove package require for cinder-volume
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-21 22:58:20.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/volume/rbd.pp', 'spec/classes/cinder_volume_rbd_spec.rb'], 'message': "Remove package require for cinder-volume

Package 'cinder-volume' is only defined in Debian distros. Leaving it defined
breaks RedHat distros.

Since $::cinder::params::ceph_init_override isn't provided by either package,
we can remove the require and just rely on the notify to do the required work.

Change-Id: I51c2a274d0fd6b00f2c4ea7e52e15066c3fd83fc
"}]
commit_message:
Remove package require for cinder-volume

Package 'cinder-volume' is only defined in Debian distros. Leaving it defined
breaks RedHat distros.

Since $::cinder::params::ceph_init_override isn't provided by either package,
we can remove the require and just rely on the notify to do the required work.

Change-Id: I51c2a274d0fd6b00f2c4ea7e52e15066c3fd83fc

subject: Do not install pip when OFFLINE=True
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-17 13:03:26.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Do not install pip when OFFLINE=True

install_pip.sh trys to fetch pip from the internet even if
OFFLINE=True. It causes stack.sh to fail if the environment
is actually disconnected from the internet. With this patch,
stack.sh skips install_pip.sh if OFFLINE=True.

Change-Id: Ica9e5cfa0a4ee684c05393896c2fd6ddbd9ccd06
Closes-Bug: 1240956
'}]
commit_message:
Do not install pip when OFFLINE=True

install_pip.sh trys to fetch pip from the internet even if
OFFLINE=True. It causes stack.sh to fail if the environment
is actually disconnected from the internet. With this patch,
stack.sh skips install_pip.sh if OFFLINE=True.

Change-Id: Ica9e5cfa0a4ee684c05393896c2fd6ddbd9ccd06
Closes-Bug: 1240956

commit_message:
Fix bugs for installing docker, bug #1237581.
  -The change in install_docker.sh corrects a typo ('=' should be '-').
   This typo resutls in 'unable to locate the packet' error when executing apt-get.

  -The second change is in hypervisor-docker fix the error for reporting
   docker is not installed when docker is actually set up. The original line
   missed the version part of the package name.

Change-Id: Ic48f45158cf84f89080f095d53c355e9f6969bfd

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 7040, 'name': 'GuoHui LIu', 'email': 'liuguohui@gmail.com', 'username': 'guohliu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2013-10-21 23:26:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_fields.py', 'nova/objects/instance_fault.py', 'nova/objects/fields.py', 'nova/objects/keypair.py', 'nova/objects/instance_action.py', 'nova/objects/pci_device.py', 'nova/objects/compute_node.py', 'nova/objects/instance_group.py', 'nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/objects/aggregate.py', 'nova/objects/security_group.py', 'nova/objects/migration.py'], 'message': 'Make Object FieldType take an object name instead of a class

The object infrastructure has a concept of an object name, which
is what we use to determine if something implements a particular
thing, and it is how we look up object classes when we
deserialize them. Since many objects will eventually reference
each other, we should be using their names to determine
compatibility, not their classes.

Related to blueprint structured-object-fields

Change-Id: I2edb8b8475662ad25e9f3319ce5e44317a2d0547
'}]
commit_message:
Make Object FieldType take an object name instead of a class

The object infrastructure has a concept of an object name, which
is what we use to determine if something implements a particular
thing, and it is how we look up object classes when we
deserialize them. Since many objects will eventually reference
each other, we should be using their names to determine
compatibility, not their classes.

Related to blueprint structured-object-fields

Change-Id: I2edb8b8475662ad25e9f3319ce5e44317a2d0547

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Using assertIn will enhance readability of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Ifa0f7e12a1ba84052e1e64ed2775056fafd2b13b
"}]
commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/virt

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Using assertIn will enhance readability of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Ifa0f7e12a1ba84052e1e64ed2775056fafd2b13b

commit_message:
Fixing possible exception on tables in tabs

When a filter action for instance goes to the server via POST, an
'action' field is not necessarily present in the POST. This results
in an uncaught exception. Fixing this so if 'action' is not present
falling back to old behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1242846

Change-Id: I693fc8174f891cb0e281e5c2810f455b368802ca

Replace incorrect Null checking to return correctly

Null checking for metadata in check_img_metadata_properties_
quota function doesn't work as designed, fix incorrect Null
checking code.

Change-Id: Id3f971091d857d6b2aebc4985cb932417c21b5dc
Fixes: bug #1220120

commit_message:
Provide gettext _ in missing locations

A while back a change was merged that moved
our shortcut for gettext out of __init__
(change here: If4125d6bcbde63df95de129ac5c83b4a6d6f130a)

This worked out fine for the most part but broke the sphinx doc
builder for a number of files.  This patch just adds the proper
import to each of these files to get the builder working correctly
again.

Change-Id: Ifed20d309566be456c9519294714ccb45de76e00
Closes-Bug: #1209406

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn - tests/api/contrib

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Adapting assertIn will enhance the readability of the test scripts.

Change-Id: Id2237b7a35c5c759e571b138faa8d1bef46a7e27

commit_message:

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn,
which was created for these types of tests.
Using assertIn will enhance readability of the test scripts.

commit_message:
Fix tuskar image element config file

Currently, due to limitations of Tuskar, we have to specify
overcloud credentials in its config file. This patch ensures,
that the correct value of keystone host is used.

Change-Id: Ib2ed652cc8f8dec532b4a9cee55be8d1278015f2

subject: Rewrite dynamicUI to use special metadata client for getting UI defs.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2013-10-21 16:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/panel/views.py', 'muranodashboard/panel/api.py', 'muranodashboard/panel/services/metadata.py', 'muranodashboard/panel/urls.py', 'muranodashboard/panel/services/__init__.py', 'muranodashboard/panel/forms.py'], 'message': 'Rewrite dynamicUI to use special metadata client for getting UI defs.

This includes:

* passing request to almost every call of dynamicUI function (for
  Keystone authentication).

* passing SHA-1 hash of current ui definitions package to Metadata
  Repository

* reducing number of import_all_service() calls in dynamic UI (with
  overhead of querying Metadata Repository they are much more costly
  now).

Change-Id: Ifb0e54940779cc0a83f91f6c8d91447c72b60adf
'}]
commit_message:
Rewrite dynamicUI to use special metadata client for getting UI defs.

This includes:

* passing request to almost every call of dynamicUI function (for
  Keystone authentication).

* passing SHA-1 hash of current ui definitions package to Metadata
  Repository

* reducing number of import_all_service() calls in dynamic UI (with
  overhead of querying Metadata Repository they are much more costly
  now).

Change-Id: Ifb0e54940779cc0a83f91f6c8d91447c72b60adf

subject: Plug Vif into Midonet using Neutron port binding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-10-07 02:49:41.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/rootwrap.d/network.filters', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'nova/network/model.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_vif.py'], 'message': 'Plug Vif into Midonet using Neutron port binding

Currently Midokura uses its own script (mm-ctl) to bind ports. However, support
for using this script is left out of the nova and neutron projects. This causes
confusion and makes deployments unnecessarily complicated for customers using
Havana. This fix is to change nova to properly use mm-ctl. Corresponding
changes will be submitted to devstack and neutron.

Change-Id: I7c9edded5ab6fe19b63e54cd6905d9242e4a90cc
Closes-Bug: 1235132
'}]
commit_message:
Plug Vif into Midonet using Neutron port binding

Currently Midokura uses its own script (mm-ctl) to bind ports. However, support
for using this script is left out of the nova and neutron projects. This causes
confusion and makes deployments unnecessarily complicated for customers using
Havana. This fix is to change nova to properly use mm-ctl. Corresponding
changes will be submitted to devstack and neutron.

Change-Id: I7c9edded5ab6fe19b63e54cd6905d9242e4a90cc
Closes-Bug: 1235132

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2013-10-02 21:56:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/volumeops.py'], 'message': 'hyperv: Initialize target_iqn in attach_volume

The target_iqn is referenced before it is declared in the
case that an exception is encountered in _login_storage_target

commit_message:
hyperv: Initialize target_iqn in attach_volume

The target_iqn is referenced before it is declared in the
case that an exception is encountered in _login_storage_target
or _get_mounted_disk_from_lun.  This causes the exception path
to cause an additional, misleading, traceback to be printed
after an exception is encountered.

This commit initializes target_iqn at the beginning of
attach_volume to avoid the traceback.

Change-Id: I1cdfb9dfa054ee4f4f6918d7bc49081ccaebab9d
Close-Bug: 1233837

subject: Improve logging messages in libvirt driver
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2013-10-14 17:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'Improve logging messages in libvirt driver

This is a trivial change to correct an uninformative log message.
There are two checks in get_instance_disk_info that look at a disk.
One checks for the type of a disk and logs its path if it is not a file.
The other checks for the path and logs the instance name it belongs to
if it does not exist. The first will log None if the path does not exist,
so reverse the order of the checks.

Closes-Bug: #1239747
Change-Id: Ieb52ba0584ad789dc55f40e0172cf5ed41e86fbe
'}]
commit_message:
Improve logging messages in libvirt driver

This is a trivial change to correct an uninformative log message.
There are two checks in get_instance_disk_info that look at a disk.
One checks for the type of a disk and logs its path if it is not a file.
The other checks for the path and logs the instance name it belongs to
if it does not exist. The first will log None if the path does not exist,
so reverse the order of the checks.

Closes-Bug: #1239747
Change-Id: Ieb52ba0584ad789dc55f40e0172cf5ed41e86fbe
